articles.title: Robots Explore Caves to Help Build Moon Homes
articles.summary: Scientists are using robots to explore lava tubes, which are like caves on the Moon and Mars. These caves can protect astronauts from dangerous radiation and meteorites. A team from Europe, including the University of Malaga, made three types of robots that work together to map these caves. They tested the robots in caves in Lanzarote, Spain. The robots go through four steps: first, they map the area near the cave entrance; second, they drop a cube with sensors inside to take measurements; third, a small rover goes down into the cave; and fourth, they explore and make 3D maps. This helps prepare for future missions to the Moon, where robots could build bases. The Space Robotics Laboratory at the University of Malaga teaches students and works with other groups to make robots smarter for space.

articles.title: A Street in Danger: Homes Might Be Torn Down Due to Flooding
articles.summary: In a small town called Ynysybwl, there is a street named Clydach Terrace where people are very scared because it floods often. The water comes from a nearby stream called Nant Clydach. Big storms like Dennis and Bert have caused the street to go underwater, damaging many houses. The people living there, like Paige who works for the ambulance service, feel anxious and worried, especially when they have to leave their pets or children at home during flood warnings. The local council is thinking about buying 16 homes on this street to help the families move to safer places. They say this is because climate change is making floods happen more often. Building a big wall to stop the flooding is too expensive, so buying the homes might be the best solution. Some houses are not included because they are higher up and safer. This plan could give the residents a fresh start away from the danger of floods.

articles.title: A Tiny Light Trap for Super-Fast Computers
articles.summary: Scientists at Stanford University have made a big discovery to help build super-fast computers called quantum computers. These computers use tiny particles called atoms to store information as qubits, which are like special zeros and ones. The problem is that atoms don't send out light quickly or in one direction, making it hard to read the information. The team created a new tool called an optical cavity, which is like a tiny trap for light. It captures light from each atom and guides it so we can read all the qubits at once. They tested this with 40 cavities and a bigger one with over 500, showing it could lead to computers with a million qubits. This could make computers much faster, solving problems in hours instead of thousands of years.

articles.title: A Silent Brain Problem Can Make Memory Loss More Likely
articles.summary: A brain disease called cerebral amyloid angiopathy (CAA) can make people four times more likely to get dementia, even if they never have a stroke. CAA happens when a protein called amyloid builds up in the blood vessels of the brain, making them weak. This can cause strokes or memory problems. A big study looked at over 1.9 million older adults and found that CAA increases dementia risk more than stroke alone. Doctors say it's important to check for memory changes in people with CAA to help prevent dementia. The study will be shared at a brain health conference in 2026.

articles.title: Baby Dinosaurs Were Important Food for Predators
articles.summary: A new study shows that baby sauropods, which were long-necked plant-eating dinosaurs, were very important for feeding meat-eating dinosaurs during the Late Jurassic period, about 150 million years ago. These baby dinosaurs were small and had no good defenses, so they were easy for predators like Allosaurus to catch. Fossils from a place called the Morrison Formation in the United States helped scientists learn this. The study used fossils to make a food web, which is like a map showing who eats whom. Even though adult sauropods were huge, their babies were tiny and not protected by their parents, similar to baby turtles today. This made them a key part of the food chain, helping predators survive. The research helps us understand how dinosaur ecosystems worked and why dinosaurs evolved in certain ways.

articles.title: SpaceX Wants to Send a Million Satellites to Space for AI
articles.summary: SpaceX, a company owned by Elon Musk, has asked for permission to launch one million satellites into space around Earth. These satellites would help power artificial intelligence, or AI, which is like smart computer programs. Instead of building big computer centers on the ground, SpaceX wants to put them in space to save energy and money. The satellites would use solar power and be far apart in space, so they might not be easy to see. SpaceX already has about 10,000 satellites called Starlink that give internet to people. Some experts worry that too many satellites could cause problems like crashes or make it hard for astronomers to study stars. Musk says space is very big and there is enough room for all the satellites.
